programme.desc: Six Oscars, including Best Picture and Actor (Tom Hanks), went to this extraordinary tale of a simple man who unwittingly becomes involved in some of the key moments of the 20th century. Meanwhile, as the remarkable parade of his life goes by, Forrest never forgets Jenny, the girl he loved as a boy, who makes her own journey through the turbulence of the 1960s and '70s that is far more troubled than the path Forrest happens upon. (Repeat).

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: In this riveting thriller, an assassination attempt is made on the president in front of a crowd, but no two witnesses can agree on who did what to whom. A Secret Service agent (Dennis Quaid) must race against time to uncover the shocking truth before the conspirators escape. Matthew Fox, Sigourney Weaver, Forest Whitaker, William Hurt. (Repeat).

programme.title: Noah
programme.desc: Noah receives a warning from God about a great flood, and constructs an ark to save creation as the planet is cleansed of sin in this stunning Biblical epic. Later, Noah and his family are forced to defend their massive vessel from malicious invaders. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Social Network
programme.desc: In this sweeping tale of Internet success, nerdy, awkward Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the Web site Facebook and becomes a billionaire, but ends up embroiled in legal disputes as the friends who helped him during his rise to the top are now eager to see him fall. (Repeat).

programme.title: Bad Behaviour
programme.desc: When a former child actor tries to reconnect with her daughter, she is led to a spiritual enlightenment retreat. Their relationship is very complicated, and they put all of their trust in a guru and experimental ideas to try and bring them back together. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Dead Don't Hurt
programme.desc: In the 1860s western frontier, the fiercely independent Vivienne Le Coudy joins her lover Holger Olsen in Elk Flats, Nevada. But the Civil War tears them apart, leaving Vivienne to fight corrupt Mayor Schiller and his ruthless partner. When Holger returns, they must confront their changed selves amidst a landscape of love, betrayal, and the struggle for justice. (Repeat).

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Luke Wilson, Vince Vaughn and Will Ferrell star in this raucous comedy reminiscent of "Animal House." They play three disillusioned men who decide to start a fraternity near their old college in an effort to recapture their youth. (Repeat).

programme.title: Divergent
programme.desc: In this inventive sci-fi film set in a society where the population is segregated by personality, a teenager classified as "divergent" uncovers a plot to kill everyone in her category and races to find out why they are considered so uniquely dangerous. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Insurgent
programme.desc: In this thrilling and nail-biting entry in the Divergent series, Tris and Four seek refuge outside of the city with the Amity faction. They convene with other Divergents and exiled survivors, and plot to fight back against the warmongering Dauntless and despot Jeanine Matthews. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey out of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization in this thrilling entry in the YA adventure series. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Dead Don't Hurt
programme.desc: In the 1860s western frontier, the fiercely independent Vivienne Le Coudy joins her lover Holger Olsen in Elk Flats, Nevada. But the Civil War tears them apart, leaving Vivienne to fight corrupt Mayor Schiller and his ruthless partner. When Holger returns, they must confront their changed selves amidst a landscape of love, betrayal, and the struggle for justice. (Repeat).

programme.title: Black Christmas
programme.desc: Katie Cassidy and Michelle Trachtenberg star in this terrifying update of a 1974 cult slasher flick about a psycho terrorizing a sorority house during the holiday season. Kristen Cloke, Crystal Lowe, Lacey Chabert. Directed by Glen Morgan. (Repeat).

programme.title: Noah
programme.desc: Noah receives a warning from God about a great flood, and constructs an ark to save creation as the planet is cleansed of sin in this stunning Biblical epic. Later, Noah and his family are forced to defend their massive vessel from malicious invaders. (Repeat).

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Jack Black earned a Golden Globe nomination for his inspired performance in Richard Linklater's whimsical comedy. He plays a manic slacker-turned-substitute teacher who transforms his sheltered private-school pupils into a full-fledged rock band. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: In this nail-biting chiller, Simon and Robyn, a young married couple, find their lives thrown into a tailspin after Simon has a chance encounter with a former acquaintance, the off-kilter Gordo. Gordo then starts giving the couple unwanted and increasingly menacing gifts. (Repeat).

programme.title: Just Mercy
programme.desc: With huge opportunities laid down even before he graduated from Harvard Law School, Bryan Stevenson's career is shaping up to be an impressive one. He, however, decides to forgo all of those offers in order to go to Alabama and represent those who cannot afford a lawyer and those who are wrongly accused. There, he takes on the case of an African-American man wrongly imprisoned for the murder of a white woman. (Repeat).

programme.title: Heat
programme.desc: A successful career criminal considers getting out of the business after one last score with his crew, while an obsessive cop desperately tries to put him behind bars. The memorable "cafe scene" marks the first time Al Pacino and Robert De Niro have appeared on-screen together. (Repeat).

programme.title: Ezra
programme.desc: Max Bernal, a struggling stand-up comedian, faces the daunting challenge of co-parenting his autistic son, Ezra, with his ex-wife, Jenna. Living with his father, Max grapples with tough choices regarding Ezra's future. Together, father and son embark on a transformative cross-country journey that bonds them in unexpected ways. What follows is a heartfelt tale of family resilience, humor, and compassion. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: Jeremy Renner heads the cast of this riveting Oscar-winning war drama about a trio of soldiers tasked with the nerve-racking job of dismantling improvised explosive devices in Baghdad. These three members of the Explosive Ordnance Disposal squad must put their fear and their personal beefs aside to keep themselves from going to "the hurt locker," the nickname soldiers have for where you recuperate after being injured in an explosion. Directed by Kathryn Bigelow. Guy Pearce, Ralph Fiennes. (Repeat).

programme.title: Close
programme.desc: Two thirteen year-olds have always been incredibly close but they drift apart after the intimacy of their relationship is questioned by schoolmates. An emotionally transformative and unforgettable portrait of the intersection of friendship and love, identity and independence, and heartbreak and healing. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mistletoe Ranch
programme.desc: Up-and-coming photographer Aimée strives to make it in the photography world. She finds herself squandering her talents as her demanding boss's assistant. A letter from her estranged family suddenly brings Aimée back to her rural childhood home, where she encounters more than she had ever hoped to expect amidst the holiday season. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity
programme.desc: Absorbing biopic of renowned Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan, who travels to England in 1913 to study at Cambridge. He faces prejudice there from many of his colleagues, but he also bonds with a professor named G.H. Hardy. In time, Ramanujan authors a number of pioneering equations. (Repeat).

programme.title: Sabrina
programme.desc: Remake of Billy Wilder's 1954 gem about the transformation of a woman and the two brothers vying for her attention. (Repeat).

programme.title: Clue
programme.desc: The whodunit board game comes to life as guests are invited to a swanky mansion to learn who is blackmailing them. (Repeat).

programme.title: Walkaway Joe
programme.desc: Teen billiard whiz Dallas looks up to his dad, Cal, as they share a love for playing billiards. But when Cal leaves their family, Dallas can't stand the absence of his father. He travels to different pool halls across the country in search of his father, until he encounters a wandering loner who tries to help him and gives him a few life lessons of his own. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Forger
programme.desc: As the Gestapo escalates their crimes against humanity across Eastern Europe, individuals of minorities and Jewish descent increasingly fear for their lives. Skilled forger Cioma Schönhaus, a young Jewish man, begins crafting fake passports for the members of his community to help shepherd them to safety. Yet his counterfeiting abilities do not stop at documents as he carefully crafts a new identity to take down the enemy from the inside. Based on true events. (Repeat).

programme.title: A Wonderful Time of the Year
programme.desc: The Marsh family is getting together for their first Christmas Eve after three years of pandemic lockdown. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scrapper
programme.desc: Living alone since her beloved mum died, 12-year-old Georgie fills the flat they shared with her own special magic. But when her absent father Jason turns up out of the blue, she's forced to confront reality. (Repeat).

programme.title: Santa Stole Our Dog
programme.desc: A family wake up on Christmas Day to find that their dog is missing. It's soon confirmed via a DNA test that Santa really does exist, so they begin a quest to get to the North Pole and reunite with the beloved pet. (Repeat).

programme.title: Nine Lives
programme.desc: A businessman buys a cat as a gift for his daughter's birthday, only to have his mind transported into the feline's body following a car accident. As his family's new pet, he begins to see his loved ones in a different light in this delightful comedy. (Repeat).

programme.title: Jules
programme.desc: Jules follows Milton (Kingsley) who lives a quiet life of routine in a small western Pennsylvania town, but finds his day upended when a UFO and its extra-terrestrial passenger crash land in his backyard. Before long, Milton develops a close relationship with the extra-terrestrial he calls "Jules." Things become complicated when two neighbors (Harris and Curtin) discover Jules and the government quickly closes in. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Perfect Game
programme.desc: Buy some peanuts, Cracker Jack and tissues for this warmhearted sports saga based on the true story of a ragtag baseball team from Monterrey, Mexico, that became the first non-U.S. squad to win the Little League World Series in 1957. Clifton Collins Jr., Cheech Marin, Louis Gossett Jr., Bruce McGill, David Koechner. Directed by William Dear. Screenwriter W. William Winokur adapted his book of the same name. (Repeat).

programme.title: Hoop Dreams
programme.desc: Inspirational documentary that follows two high-school basketball players over four years as they set their sights on college scholarships and a chance to play in the NBA. (Repeat).

programme.title: A Wonderful Time of the Year
programme.desc: The Marsh family is getting together for their first Christmas Eve after three years of pandemic lockdown. (Repeat).

programme.title: Past Lives
programme.desc: Growing up in a small South Korean town, Hae Sung and Nora shared a deep, inextricable bond that was suddenly torn asunder by Nora's family's emigration to the United States. Twenty years later, the childhood sweethearts inexplicably cross paths and share one emotionally-charged week that forces them to confront long-dormant feelings and their hopes for the future. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Moon and Back
programme.desc: Isabel May stars in this comedy as a high school student stumbling through her senior year, until she discovers her dad's unfinished screenplay and makes his crazy dream her reality. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Honeymooners
programme.desc: Big-screen take on the classic sitcom about a blustery, big-scheming New York City bus driver and his sewer-worker pal. (Repeat).

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: In this uproarious holiday farce, an uptight optometrist hits the roof when his neighbor decides to decorate his house with enough Christmas lights to be seen from space. (Repeat).

programme.title: Bad News Bears
programme.desc: A cynical, hard-drinking ex-baseball player (Billy Bob Thornton) grudgingly coaches an inept Little League team in this hit-and-miss remake of the 1976 classic. Greg Kinnear, Marcia Gay Harden. Directed by Richard Linklater ("School of Rock"). (Repeat).

programme.title: Yours, Mine & Ours
programme.desc: A widower with eight kids marries a widow who has 10 of her own in this remake of the 1968 family movie. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mistletoe Ranch
programme.desc: Up-and-coming photographer Aimée strives to make it in the photography world. She finds herself squandering her talents as her demanding boss's assistant. A letter from her estranged family suddenly brings Aimée back to her rural childhood home, where she encounters more than she had ever hoped to expect amidst the holiday season. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Christmas Classic
programme.desc: This holiday movie follows Elizabeth, a transplanted "city girl" type of career woman who returns to her hometown to buy a ski resort owned by her ex, Randy. She works for her fiancé's father, so Elizabeth wants to clinch the sale at his behest. Randy objects to being bought outright but proposes an alternative. If Elizabeth could win their town's annual Christmas-related competitions, he'd sell his property. The problem is, she needs to beat the long-running champion: her perfectionist sister. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Brady Bunch Movie
programme.desc: A send-up of the TV series, it's the story of a lovely lady, a man named Brady, and their kids, whose wholesome '70s natures clashes with the grungy '90s. (Repeat).

programme.title: Weird Science
programme.desc: A pair of high-school geeks who are hapless with members of the opposite sex create what they believe is the ideal woman using a computer, and then a lightning storm brings that woman to life. (Repeat).

programme.title: School Ties
programme.desc: A promising football player who wins a scholarship to a 1950s prep school must conceal his religion from his teammates and friends. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: A greedy TV executive learns the true meaning of Christmas in this updating of "A Christmas Carol". (Repeat).

programme.title: Downhill Racer
programme.desc: Robert Redford as an egotist skiing with the U.S. team in Europe. Fine skiing footage; filmed on location. Gene Hackman, Camilla Sparv, Jim McMullan. D.K.: Kenneth Kirk. Mayo: Dabney Coleman. Machet: Karl Michael Vogler. Tommy: Joe Jay Albert. Directed by Michael Ritchie. (Repeat).

programme.title: Pelé: Birth of a Legend
programme.desc: This electrifying biopic of Brazilian soccer star Pelé recounts his youth in the slums of São Paulo and his rapid ascension to the national team, where, at the age of just 17, he helped lead the squad to their first ever World Cup victory in 1958. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Brady Bunch Movie
programme.desc: A send-up of the TV series, it's the story of a lovely lady, a man named Brady, and their kids, whose wholesome '70s natures clashes with the grungy '90s. (Repeat).

programme.title: Paddington
programme.desc: After his home in Peru is destroyed, a talking bear named Paddington travels to London, where he is taken in by a kindly family. However, a museum taxidermist is determined to make a trophy out of him in this endearing adventure for all ages. (Repeat).

programme.title: Arthur and the Invisibles
programme.desc: With knowing nods to "The Wizard of Oz" and "Honey, I Shrunk the Kids," this wondrous blend of live action and stunning computer-animation is a blast. To save the family farm, a youngster (Freddie Highmore) shrinks in size to enter a magical world of wood sprites and search for treasure. Mia Farrow. Directed by Luc Besson, who co-wrote the script, which was based on two of his own Arthur best sellers. Among the voice talent are Madonna, Robert De Niro, Jimmy Fallon, David Bowie and Snoop Dogg. (Repeat).

programme.title: Free Birds
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy for the entire family, two turkeys travel back in time to the first Thanksgiving in order to change the traditional menu and save their kind from being served with a side of cranberry sauce for the holiday. (Repeat).

programme.title: It Could Happen to You
programme.desc: A cop offers to share his lottery ticket with a waitress he can't afford to tip. He hits the jackpot and wins millions, but his girlfriend tries to convince him to welch on his promise to the waitress. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Age of Adaline
programme.desc: A beautiful woman stops aging after a car accident, and remains 29 for several decades in this intriguing fantasy. She refuses to get close to anyone in order to keep her condition a secret, but reconsiders her solitary lifestyle after falling in love with a philanthropist. (Repeat).

programme.title: Marcel: The Shell with Shoes On
programme.desc: The animated film follows the life of a young mollusk named Marcel as he discovers the world anew. When a documentary filmmaker shares an online snippet of Marcel, the shy shell goes viral. Soon, Marcel goes on a life-changing adventure to find his lost family. (Repeat).

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Jack Black earned a Golden Globe nomination for his inspired performance in Richard Linklater's whimsical comedy. He plays a manic slacker-turned-substitute teacher who transforms his sheltered private-school pupils into a full-fledged rock band. (Repeat).

programme.title: Wayne's World
programme.desc: Best friends Wayne and Garth are hired to host their public access show professionally. Wayne falls for Cassandra, the lead singer in a metal band, and must contend with a handsome network executive who plans to ruin their show and steal away Cassandra. Based on the iconic SNL skit. (Repeat).

programme.title: Hugo
programme.desc: In this wondrous fantasy film directed by Martin Scorsese, a young orphan named Hugo Cabret (Asa Butterfield) lives in a train station in 1930s Paris and tries to repair a mechanical man built by his father. Eventually, Hugo befriends a filmmaker and his goddaughter, who help him understand the mystery of his dad's invention. (Repeat).

programme.title: Free Birds
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy for the entire family, two turkeys travel back in time to the first Thanksgiving in order to change the traditional menu and save their kind from being served with a side of cranberry sauce for the holiday. (Repeat).

programme.title: Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: A single woman, who is newly unemployed, dreads the annual Thanksgiving visit with her loving, but overbearing family. (Repeat).

programme.title: Get Over It
programme.desc: Kirsten Dunst stars in this charming teen romance about a guy (Ben Foster) who tries to win back his girlfriend by getting a part in the school play. With the help of a friend (Dunst), he hones his acting skills and discovers the meaning of true love. Sisqo, Martin Short, Melissa Sagemiller, Shane West, Colin Hanks, Mila Kunis. (Repeat).

programme.title: All Styles
programme.desc: A young hip-hop artist has a falling out with his dance crew over his decision to go to college before a big competition. (Repeat).

programme.title: Marcel: The Shell with Shoes On
programme.desc: The animated film follows the life of a young mollusk named Marcel as he discovers the world anew. When a documentary filmmaker shares an online snippet of Marcel, the shy shell goes viral. Soon, Marcel goes on a life-changing adventure to find his lost family. (Repeat).

programme.title: A Wonderful Time of the Year
programme.desc: The Marsh family is getting together for their first Christmas Eve after three years of pandemic lockdown. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mistletoe Ranch
programme.desc: Up-and-coming photographer Aimée strives to make it in the photography world. She finds herself squandering her talents as her demanding boss's assistant. A letter from her estranged family suddenly brings Aimée back to her rural childhood home, where she encounters more than she had ever hoped to expect amidst the holiday season. (Repeat).

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: In this uproarious holiday farce, an uptight optometrist hits the roof when his neighbor decides to decorate his house with enough Christmas lights to be seen from space. (Repeat).

programme.title: Nine Lives
programme.desc: A businessman buys a cat as a gift for his daughter's birthday, only to have his mind transported into the feline's body following a car accident. As his family's new pet, he begins to see his loved ones in a different light in this delightful comedy. (Repeat).

programme.title: Blinded by the Light
programme.desc: A second-generation British-Pakistani teenager comes of age in a small town during the Thatcher era, rebelling against parental and cultural expectations and the confines of provincial life with the help of Bruce Springsteen's empowering music and relatable lyricism. (Repeat).

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: An urban teen moves to a rural Midwestern town where dancing is outlawed and fights to stage a high-school prom complete with dancing. He also falls for a local girl whose minister dad is behind the dirty dancing boycott. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Terminal
programme.desc: An Eastern European man is forced to live at JFK Airport after his visa is canceled due to a coup in his own country in this charming drama. In time, the terminal becomes a virtual country within itself, complete with culture, ambition, status, diversity and the need for love. (Repeat).

programme.title: While You Were Sleeping
programme.desc: A lonely turnstile clerk saves a man who has fallen onto the tracks, then poses as the comatose man's fiancée to gain access to his condition. (Repeat).

programme.title: Hangman
programme.desc: In this terrifying crime thriller, a veteran homicide detective and his younger partner probe a chain of murders committed by a serial killer, who leaves behind clues related to the children's game Hangman. The case eventually reveals a connection between the culprit and the older cop.

programme.title: Monster Hunter
programme.desc: After Lieutenant Artemis and her team of elite soldiers go through a portal and get transported to a different dimension, they are faced with a threat they have never encountered before: huge, powerful monsters. In the middle of the chaos, however, they meet The Hunter, a mysterious warrior whose impressive skills have allowed him to last in the new, hostile land. Together, they team up to secure their survival and find a way home.

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Afterlife
programme.desc: Single mother Callie seeks a fresh start with her two children, moving her family to a rural midwestern town. Yet they soon experience a host of supernatural circumstances, unveiling a strange connection to the children's eccentric grandfather. Based on the 1984 cult classic film.

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: In this thrilling and hilarious reboot of the beloved sci-fi-comedy franchise, two paranormal researchers join forces with a nuclear engineer and a subway attendant to fight off a slew of ghosts that have invaded New York City. Eventually, they come face-to-face with an evil entity who can control human beings.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: This thrilling second installment of the popular "Twilight" saga finds Bella Swan in pieces after her vampire boyfriend leaves town. She soon reconnects with a childhood friend and realizes he's hiding a dark secret that may hold the key to her survival. Extended version.

programme.title: Spoiler Alert
programme.desc: The narrative tells the true story of Michael Ausiello and Kit Cowan. The young couple is in love and ready to spend the rest of their lives together. When Kit is diagnosed with terminal cancer, the couple's future is thwarted in unexpected ways. What follows is a tale portraying the power to rise above every obstacle in the face of love.

programme.title: M3GAN
programme.desc: A brilliant toy company roboticist uses artificial intelligence to develop M3GAN, a life-like doll programmed to emotionally bond with her newly orphaned niece. But when the doll's programming works too well, she becomes overprotective of her new friend with terrifying results.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
programme.desc: In this magical installment of the "Twilight" saga, Bella becomes pregnant after marrying Edward, which leads to a dangerous childbirth and a shocking realization for werewolf Jacob Black.

programme.title: Hot Fuzz
programme.desc: Director-writer Edgar Wright, writer-star Simon Pegg and costar Nick Frost, the U.K. trio behind the frighteningly silly but bloody hilarious "Shaun of the Dead," reunite for this smashingly entertaining cop-buddy joyride. Pegg is a big-city superofficer who gets teamed with Frost's small-town booby bobby to fight crime in the quaint old town of Sandford, where things are not as calm as they seem. Features cameos by Cate Blanchett, Timothy Dalton and director Peter Jackson.

programme.title: Shaun of the Dead
programme.desc: Yuks and yucks collide in this uproarious British comedy, a seamless blend of wit and horror. Simon Pegg stars as a beer-swilling slacker who tries to get his miserable life in order while repelling the zombies that have overrun London. Pegg also co-wrote the script with director Edgar Wright. Kate Ashfield, Nick Frost, Lucy Davis, Bill Nighy, Martin Freeman.

programme.title: Paul
programme.desc: In this wildly funny road-trip comedy, sci-fi geeks Graeme (Simon Pegg) and Clive (Nick Frost) pick up an extraterrestrial hitchhiker named Paul and help him get back to his mother ship, while the FBI closes in on them. Directed by Greg Mottola.

programme.title: Naked Singularity
programme.desc: In New York City, public defense lawyer Casi feels his utopian ideals falter amidst the city's corrupt justice system. Facing disbarment and disillusioned with society at large, Casi concocts an outlandish heist to rob his wealthy drug lord client. Based on the novel by Sergio De La Pava.

programme.title: Oz the Great and Powerful
programme.desc: In this dazzling fantasy adventure, shady Kansas magician Oscar Diggs is mysteriously transported to the magical land of Oz, where he encounters three powerful witches and is tasked with rooting out an evil force that threatens the entire kingdom.

programme.title: Manodrome
programme.desc: This drama follows Ralphie, a man wrestling with many insecurities. Having recently lost his job as an Uber driver, he desperately tries to make ends meet since his girlfriend is pregnant. He encounters a group of men who seems to have it all together. Ralphie is attracted to this all-male family setup, even if there are displays and tenets of toxic masculinity hovering around them. As he becomes a member of this family, the toxicity soon affects his life and his relationship.

programme.title: Ordinary Angels
programme.desc: Widower Ed Schmitt is taking care of a sick three-year-old daughter. She desperately needs a liver transplant, a medical and financial feat that Ed must face and overcome for his daughter to survive. Hairdresser Sharon Stevens steps in to help facilitate funds and logistics to help the father-daughter tandem. However, they will soon face a catastrophic snowstorm, a larger enemy that blocks their way.

programme.title: Oz the Great and Powerful
programme.desc: In this dazzling fantasy adventure, shady Kansas magician Oscar Diggs is mysteriously transported to the magical land of Oz, where he encounters three powerful witches and is tasked with rooting out an evil force that threatens the entire kingdom.

The girl finds Jessica's childhood teddy bear named Chauncey, and she encourages the child to treat Chauncey as an imaginary friend. However, when sinister things start happening as Alice also behaves badly, Jessica suspects there's more than meets the eye with Chauncey.

programme.title: The Strangers: Chapter 1
programme.desc: While on holiday, a young couple's car suddenly breaks down in an insular rural community, so they take refuge in a remote cabin awaiting repairs. Yet when a trio of masked strangers begins lurking outside the cabin, the couple quickly realizes that not all is as it seems in this town.

programme.title: A Thousand and One
programme.desc: The foster care system can be punishing for children, especially when they are living in a hostile situation. Inez commits a necessary crime and kidnaps a six-year-old boy named Terry. The new mother and son duo now live in New York City, and Inez needs to protect her child at all costs.

programme.title: Escape Room: Tournament of Champions
programme.desc: The original escape room game scenario team's survivors, Zoey and Ben, meet up in the present to face another round orchestrated by the Gamemaster as they are joined by a new set of teammates composed of diverse individuals. However, the original group's members died one by one inside different escape rooms as the team progressed into the game. Zoey and Ben try to figure things out so as not to repeat the same tragedy.

programme.title: Champions
programme.desc: Contending with misdemeanor charges, disgraced minor league basketball coach Marcus receives orders from the court to take a team of players with intellectual disabilities under his wing. Longing for the skills of his former team, Marcus initially struggles to connect with his new team, given the variety of challenges their diagnoses present. Yet the athletes' continued perseverance against the odds inspires Marcus to change his ways, in turn helping the team reach new heights.

programme.desc: Medical emergencies at Baylor University Medical Center in Dallas include a rodeo champ trampled by a bull; a man whose house collapsed on him; a motor-scooter accident victim with internal bleeding; a 3-year-old with seizures. (Repeat).

programme.desc: Oklahoma is a land of heroes past and present. "Never say never" is a motto that describes its citizens, as well as the medical staff at the University of Oklahoma Trauma Center, who never say "never," even to the most severely injured patients. Among those in need of care are a man who fell off his motorcycle at 75 mph and requires a triple amputation, a woman who fell into a sewer hole, and a patient who was pinned under his tractor for several hours. (Repeat).

programme.title: Trauma: Life in the E.R.
programme.desc: The Level One trauma center of San Francisco General Hospital is observed. Included: a drug addict infected with flesh-eating bacteria; a man on drugs who tried to direct traffic; a man with a high blood-alcohol level who was stabbed. (Repeat).

programme.desc: A woman with a lung disease fears her hoarding is making her condition worse; a woman's clutter limits her mobility in her house, while her neighbors complain about the garbage bags piling up outside. (Repeat).

programme.desc: A man's mobile home is cluttered with piles of clothes and expired foods; a woman may be evicted from her home unless she can get rid of belongings she's been hoarding for decades. (Repeat).

programme.desc: A woman's hoarding may have done irreparable damage to her relationship with her daughter; a woman realizes she needs help after years of collecting have rendered her home uninhabitable. (Repeat).

programme.desc: Two moms who are hoarders get help after realizing their obsessions are tearing their families apart. (Repeat).

programme.desc: A hoarder with obsessive-compulsive disorder is profiled. Also: a man is in denial about his hoarding. (Repeat).

programme.desc: A woman's face-lift goes awry; a hospital chaplain's personality change flummoxes the staff; a pregnant woman needs immediate treatment. (Repeat).

programme.desc: A woman with two children weighs more than 600 pounds, so she agrees to go on an extreme new diet, but her weight-loss efforts are threatened by her debilitating habits and a child's health emergency. (Repeat).
